$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendardateMacro.j.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendardateMacro.js

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/UtilMacros.text:
\define transclude(tid)
    <$transclude tiddler="$tid$" mode="block"/>
\end

\define sliderCBasic(content imageClosed:"{{$:/core/images/right-arrow}}" imageOpen:"{{$:/core/images/down-arrow}}" tooltip qual:"$:/simplecalendar/slider" default:"close")
	<$reveal type="match" state=<<qualify $qual$>> text="close" default=$default$ animate="yes">
		<$button set=<<qualify $qual$>> setTo="open" class="tc-btn-invisible" tooltip="""$tooltip$""">
			$imageClosed$
		</$button>
	</$reveal>
	<$reveal type="match" state=<<qualify $qual$>> text="open" default=$default$ animate="yes">
		<$button set=<<qualify $qual$>> setTo="close" class="tc-btn-invisible" >
			$imageOpen$
		</$button>
		$content$
	</$reveal>
\end
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/UtilMacros.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/UtilMacros

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/simplecale.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/simplecalendarUtils.js

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarMa.text:
\define simplecalendar(name:"SimpleCalendar" yearState:"!!year" monthState:"!!month" startingDay:"1" yearInit:"<<now YYYY>>" monthInit:"<<now MM>>" config:"$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarConfigDefault")
<$vars a={{$yearState$}} b={{$monthState$}} c={{$config$}} yInit=$yearInit$ mInit=$monthInit$>
	<$macrocall $name="simplecalendarTable" name="""$name$""" yearState="""$yearState$""" monthState="""$monthState$""" startingDay="""$startingDay$""" yearInit=<<yInit>> monthInit=<<mInit>> config="""$config$"""/>
</$vars>
\end
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarMa.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarMacro

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHe.text:
What I call here a style is a data tiddler containing elements for identifying days and applying a style to them (mainly a background color).

!!!Adding a style
A style is mainly a background color for a cell. But you can add some other css elements.

Click the "+" button at the top of the style manager

!!!Choosing the color
Look at the line that begins with "Background-color" and click on the right arrow after the edit zone. It opens a slider

Then choose with the color picker.

Then close the slider.

!!!Choosing the function
For now you can use 5 different function to select the days you want to style :

*All days : the style is applied to all day cells
*List of days : the stytle is applied to the specified days. Input the days with the following format : YYYY-0MM-0DD (like 2017-05-08) and leave just a space between tw dates.
*Range of days : the style is applied to the starting day of the range up to the ending day.
*Day numbers of days : the style is applied to the days corresponding to the numbers. For instance to apply a style to the saturdays and sundays, type ``0 6`` in the arguments.
*Today : obvious.

!!!Priority
Don't forget to set a priority ; this is haoxwthe styles are applied. For instance put a low priority (for instance 1) for "All days", and a greater one to style the saturdays and sundays, the highiest for "Today". This is just a suggestion. Try by yourself.

!!!Important
When you have finished editing a style, click again on the color rectangle to close and save the style.
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHe.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHelp/StyleManager

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHe.text:
|!Parameter name|!Usage|!Default|
|name|Naming a calendar is useful mainly when you want to use more than one in a TW and don't want the styling of the cells to interfere.|"~SimpleCalendar"|
|yearState|Text reference where to store the year|"!!yearState", meaning that the year is stored in the field "yearState" of the current tiddler.|
|monthState|Text reference where to store the month|"!!monthState", meaning that the month is stored in the field "monthState" of the current tiddler.|
|startingDay|A number to specify the starting day for the week (0 for Sunday, 1 for Monday, ..., 6 for Saturday)|1 ; week starting on Monday|
|yearInit|Init value for the year, used if yearState does not exist yet or is empty|``<<now YYYY>>``, meaning the current year is used|
|monthInit|Init value for the month, used if monthState does not exist yet or is empty|``<<now MM>>``, meaning the current month is used|
|config|Name of a data tiddler containing some other coonfiguration options|$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarConfigDefault|
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHe.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHelp/Parameters

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHe.text: !!!Changing the month/year Use the following buttons at the top of the calendar to go to : *the previous year   {{$:/core/images/chevron-left}} *the previous month   {{$:/core/images/left-arrow}} *the next month   {{$:/core/images/right-arrow}} *the next year   {{$:/core/images/chevron-right}} *the current year and month : by clicking the center cell (with the month and year) !!!Calling the style manager At the bottom of the calendar you have two thin light grey zones, one on the left, one on the right. The left one allows you to display a tiddler to deal with the styling of the calendar cells, the style manager. This tiddler is named after the name of the calendar : the prefix is ``$:/simplecalendar/`` then comes the name of the calendar (see macro parameters below) and the suffix is ``_Days``. For instance, if you call ``<>``, the default name is SimpleCalendar. So the style manager is $:/simplecalendar/SimpleCalendar_Days !!!Looking for help The thin light grey zone at the bottom right of the calendar calls this help tiddler.
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHe.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHelp/Interface

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHe.text:
This is a data tiddler containing some configuration values for the simplecalendar macro.

You can modify this tiddler, but it would be more safe to copy it, modify this copy and give this modified tiddler as an argument for the simplecalendar macro.

To be continued ...
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHe.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHelp/ConfigTiddler
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarHelp

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarDy.text:
<$list filter="[tag[CalendarDaysItem]] +[nsort[priority]]">

table td.calendar-{{##style}}
{
	background-color: {{##background-color}};
	{{##othercss}}
}
</$list>

table td.calendar-datepicker-cell .tc-tiddlylink
{
	color:red;
}
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarDy.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarDynamicCSS

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarDa.text:
\define actions() <$list filter="[{##function}] +[suffix[holidays]]" variable="functionTiddler"> <$action-setfield $index="startingDay" $value=""/> <$action-setfield $index="endingDay" $value=""/> <$action-setfield $index="listOfDaysNumbers" $value=""/> <$list filter="[{##function}] +[prefix[holidaysRange]]" variable="functionTiddler"> <$action-setfield $index="listOfDays" $value=""/> <$action-setfield $index="listOfDaysNumbers" $value=""/> <$list filter="[{##function}] +[prefix[restdays]]" variable="functionTiddler"> <$action-setfield $index="startingDay" $value=""/> <$action-setfield $index="endingDay" $value=""/> <$action-setfield $index="listOfDays" $value=""/> \end \define actions-filter-days() <$action-setfield $index="listOfDays" $value=""/> <$list filter={{##filterListOfDays}} variable="day"> <$action-listops $tiddler=<> $index="listOfDays" $subfilter="[list[days]append]"/> \end <$select index='function' actions=<>>    Arguments for the function : <$button class="tc-btn-invisible" tooltip='- holidays : list of days in YYY-0MM-ODD format. For instance : "2016-09-10 2016-10-01 2016-12-25 2016-12-31" - holidaysRange : starting day and ending day. For instance : "2016-09-01" and "2016-10-25" - restdays : list od day numerical codes (0 for sunday, 1 for monday, ... 6 for saturday). For instance : "6 0" for saturday and sunday'>  ? 
<$list filter="[{##function}] +[suffix[holidays]]" variable="functionTiddler"> List of days : <$edit-text index="listOfDays" tag="input" size="30"/>
Filter : <$edit-text index="filterListOfDays" tag="input" size="30"/>  <$button class="tc-btn-invisible" actions=<>>Eval <$list filter="[{##function}] +[prefix[holidaysRange]]" variable="functionTiddler"> Starting day : <$edit-text index="startingDay" tag="input" size="10"/>   Ending Day : <$edit-text index="endingDay" tag="input" size="10"/> <$list filter="[{##function}] +[prefix[restdays]]" variable="functionTiddler"> List of days numbers : <$edit-text index="listOfDaysNumbers" tag="input" size="20"/>

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/calendarCe.title: $:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/calendarCellCSSMacro.js
$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/calendarCellCSSFunctions.js

$:/plugins/frd/simplecalendar/CalendarCe.text:
\define sc_basic(year month day dayNum format)
$day$
\end

\define sc_linkNavigateToJournal(year month day dayNum format)
    <$set name="journalTitle" value=<<date "$format$" $year$ $month$ $day$>>>
        <$button class="tc-btn-invisible">
            <$link to=<<journalTitle>> tooltip=<<journalTitle>>>$day$
                <$action-navigate $to=<<journalTitle>>/>
            </$link>
        </$button>
    </$set>
\end

\define sc_linkNavigateToOrCreateViewModeJournal(year month day dayNum format)
    <$set name="journalTitle" value=<<date "$format$" $year$ $month$ $day$>>>
		<$list filter=<<sc_LNTOCVMJ_filter>>>
			<$button class="tc-btn-invisible tc-tiddlylink" tooltip=<<journalTitle>>>
				<$action-setfield $tiddler="NewJournalTemplate" $field="title" $value=<<journalTitle>>/>
				<$action-navigate $to=<<journalTitle>>/>
				//$day$//
			</$button>
		</$list>
		<$list filter=<<sc_LNTOCEMJ_filter>>>
			<$button class="tc-btn-invisible tc-tiddlylink" tooltip=<<journalTitle>>>
				<$action-navigate $to=<<journalTitle>>/>
				$day$
			</$button>
		</$list>
    </$set>
\end

\define sc_linkNavigateToOrCreateEditModeJournal(year month day dayNum format)
    <$set name="journalTitle" value=<<date "$format$" $year$ $month$ $day$>>>
		<$list filter=<<sc_LNTOCVMJ_filter>>>
			<$button class="tc-btn-invisible tc-tiddlylink" tooltip=<<journalTitle>>>
				<$action-sendmessage $message="tm-new-tiddler" $param="NewJournalTemplate" title=<<journalTitle>>/>
				//$day$//
			</$button>
		</$list>
		<$list filter=<<sc_LNTOCEMJ_filter>>>
			<$button class="tc-btn-invisible tc-tiddlylink" tooltip=<<journalTitle>>>
				<$action-navigate $to=<<journalTitle>>/>
				$day$
			</$button>
		</$list>
    </$set>
\end

\define sc_LNTOCVMJ_filter() [[$(journalTitle)$]] +[is[missing]]

\define sc_LNTOCEMJ_filter() [[$(journalTitle)$]] +[is[tiddler]]
